content: I was discharged with an re-3p code. I tried to get back in and was denied a waiver bc i had not gotten the problem i had fixed, which was the fact that I had keratoconus in my left eye. I had it corrected and tried to get into another branch. The denied it. i am not sure if i got PDQ but if I did does that disqualify me from getting back into the corps? If if it does not do i have a chance of getting a waiver?
reply: I was discharged with an re-3p code. I tried to get back in and was denied a waiver bc i had not gotten the problem i had fixed, which was the fact that I had keratoconus in my left eye. I had it corrected and tried to get into another branch. The denied it. i am not sure if i got PDQ but if I did does that disqualify me from getting back into the corps? If if it does not do i have a chance of getting a waiver?
title: Re-3p

content: Do you remember pipedreamsandbabies giving you some information a while ago about your problem: Posted Sun 07 September 2008 11:44 AM Hide. See AR-40-501 2–12. Eyes c. Cornea. 1) Current or history of corneal dystrophy of any type (371.5), including but not limited to keratoconus (371.6) of any degree is disqualifying. (2) History of refractive surgery including, but not limited to: Lamellar (P11.7) and/or penetrating keratoplasty (P11.6). Radial Keratotomy and Astigmatic Keratotomy is disqualifying. Listen up! Keratoconus is a permanent disqualifer with little or No chance of a waiver, you need to explore other options! Good Luck!
